intro: Nesaea lanceolata var. stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nesaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
